sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin praises China's plan for peace in Ukraine, but Kyiv says it falls short of its demands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: NATO's Secretary General says it welcomes China's peace initiative, but Ukraine must have the final say.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As protests continue across France, President Macron is due to give a live TV interview about the social unrest over his government's pension reform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: At least 13 people have been killed and hundreds injured after a magnitude 6.5 earthquake hits large swathes of Afghanistan and Pakistan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: One in four people around the world can't access clean drinking water, something the UN wishes to address as it marks World Water Day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Beijing's 12-point peace plan to end the war in Ukraine has been described as falling short on details by Ukraine and its allies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The plan, a topic of discussion between Presidents Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin at their summit in Moscow, doesn't require Russia to withdraw its troops, a basic requisite made by Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: In Washington, the White House response was clear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: So now if China wants to play a constructive role here in this conflict, then they ought to press Russia to pull its troops out of Ukraine and Ukrainian sovereign territory. They should urge President Putin to cease bombing cities, hospitals and schools, to stop the war crimes and the atrocities and end the war today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It could happen right now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The state visit by Xi to Moscow coincided with Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida's surprise visit to Kyiv, making him the first leader of Japan to visit a country in conflict since World War II.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: During their press briefing, President Zelensky said he's invited China for talks on Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: President Zelensky said he's invited China for talks on Ukraine. and diplomatic channels have passed our peace formula and are invited to take part in this formula.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We invite you to dialogue, we await your response.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: China has sought to portray itself as a neutral party in the Ukraine conflict, but so far there is no indication of an equivalent trip to Kyiv by President Xi Jinping.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: by President Xi Jinping.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: NATO says it welcomes all peace initiatives, but Ukraine must have the final say. As leaders of China and Russia meet in Moscow for talks on Tuesday,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg asks Beijing not to support Moscow's war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: China's peace proposal includes some positive aspects and elements which I support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: For instance, the importance of nuclear safety, of protection of civilians, and not least underlying the importance of sovereignty, territorial integrity and independence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And of course any peace solution for Ukraine must be based on these principles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: NATO says there's no proof that China is delivering lethal weapons to Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Stoltenberg warns Beijing anyway against supplying them to the Kremlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: He also notes that the two countries are getting closer and closer. The meeting that takes place in Moscow is part of a pattern we have seen over the last years where China and Russia are coming closer and closer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: We have to remember that just a couple of weeks or a few weeks before the invasion last February, President Xi and President Putin met in Beijing where they signed a joint declaration promising each other a partnership without any limits.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As part of NATO's annual report, the Secretary General pointed out that defence spending among Alliance members increased by 2.2 per cent last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He also confirmed that Finland's membership process should be over before the alliance's summit in July.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But Sweden will likely have to wait until after the Turkish elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After the EU's announcement of collective ammunition purchases for Ukraine, a setback for the country's war effort.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Bulgaria has said it will not be part of the joint programme, nor will it supply fighter jets or tanks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Bulgarian president said no such support could be given under the current caretaker government. The Ukrainian leadership has, however, received a diplomatic boost from a powerful Western ally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Visiting Ukraine, Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida reiterated Tokyo's support for Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Because of its pacifist constitution, Japan has not supplied offensive weapons, but Kishida's trip indicates Ukraine may receive further financial and other aid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Another night of disturbances on the sidelines of a rally against the French government's plan to reform the pension system. A new law, which includes a rise in the retirement age to 64, was adopted on Monday evening through Article 49 of the Constitution without a vote of MPs and after two rejected motions of no confidence in the government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: days but has told allies he has no intention of dissolving parliament, reshuffling the government or calling a referendum on pension reform to calm tensions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He will also stand by his beleaguered prime minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Macron is due to resurface today, according to the Elysee Palace, to give a live televised interview about the social and political tensions over the pension reform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But anger over the government's decision to invoke a notorious constitutional power to force the reform through the National Assembly without a vote last week has dismayed many ruling party MPs. A further day of protests and strikes is set for Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Britain's former Prime Minister Boris Johnson has admitted that he misled Parliament

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: by telling MPs that parties at his Downing Street office did not break Covid lockdown rules.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: But in written evidence to a parliamentary committee, he insisted that he acted in good faith. Johnson was fined by police for breaking the Covid rules that his own government set.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: In his statement, the former Prime Minister said, I did not intentionally or recklessly mislead the House on 1 December 2021, 8 December or on any other date. I would never have dreamed of doing so.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Johnson will appear in person before the committee on Wednesday. If it finds that he deliberately lied to the House of Commons, he could be suspended and ultimately face a by-election in his constituency in which he holds a slim majority of just over 7,000.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Johnson was forced out as Prime Minister after the latest in a series of scandals last July.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: At least 13 people have been killed and hundreds injured after a magnitude 6.5 earthquake shook

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: huge swathes of Afghanistan and Pakistan on Tuesday evening, leading residents of Kabul to spend the night out in the streets in fear of going back indoors in Islamabad video footage shows scores of people fleeing offices and shopping centers when the quake struck The earthquake comes nearly two months after the devastating 7.8 magnitude quake struck southeastern Turkey and northern Syria, killing around 51,000 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis has called a general election for May, two months before his Conservative government's mandate ends in July.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The country has seen a series of angry mass protests following its worst ever rail disaster last month, which killed 57 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Protesters accused successive governments of failing to address safety issues, a legacy of the nation's decade-long financial crisis which ended in 2018.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Now Mitsotakis may pay the price as his party slips in the opinion polls.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Israeli parliament, or Knesset, has voted to repeal a 2005 law that saw four Jewish settlements in the occupied West Bank dismantled at the same

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: time as Israeli troops withdrew from the Gaza Strip. The move could pave the way for an official Israeli return to the abandoned West Bank area. It amounts to a reversal of restrictions on Israeli settler expansion. The vote has been condemned by the U.S. and several other countries as incendiary, coming at a time of heightened tensions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: It is a daily struggle for residents of Venezuela's capital, Caracas. Dozens of people wait to fill jugs of water from the stream flowing from the Wairarapano Hill, where they tap water from broken pipes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We come here every two weeks to drink water.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And for the house, I have to take it every day because it comes to us once a week for two hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The UN reports that two billion people worldwide, or a quarter of the global population, don't have access to safe drinking water, Something the United Nations wants to draw attention to as it marks World Water Day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: 10% of the global population currently lives in areas that are high or critical water stress.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In our report we said that up to 3.5 billion people live under conditions of water stress at least one month a year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: In developing countries, many problems related to drinking water are linked to rapid population growth and a lack of sanitary controls.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And that puts people's health at risk. It's not easy. Our children, they often have infections, even at the level of the stomach.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I have a sister who is pregnant, she recently had a chronic infection.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Additionally, 1.4 million people die each year from diseases caused by water shortages or poor sanitation and hygiene.
